title: 107_hr5404
content: The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" is cited as the short title. Section 202 of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding the termination of monthly insurance benefits upon death. The Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection stating that if an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their monthly insurance benefit will be 50% of the original amount, rounded up to the nearest dollar. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made, and the payment for the month of death follows specific guidelines. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust monthly insurance benefits for individuals who die within the first 15 days of a month, with the payment following specific guidelines outlined in section 204(d). Additionally, section 223 of the Act is amended to redesignate subsection (j) as subsection (k) and add a new subsection after subsection (i). The last payment of benefit terminated due to death. If an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their monthly insurance benefit will be 50% of the original amount, rounded up to the nearest dollar. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. Payment for the month of death will follow standard procedures. Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals under Section 228 of the Act (42 U.S.C. 428) will be adjusted in accordance with section 204(d) if the individual dies within the first 15 days of a month. "Last Payment of Benefit Terminated by Death" "In cases where an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their monthly insurance benefit will be 50% of the original amount, rounded up to the nearest dollar. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. Payment for the month of death will follow standard procedures." The month of death will determine the payment of benefits according to section 204(d) of the Social Security Act. Amendments have been made to sections 202(a) and 202(b)(1) regarding the payment of benefits for the month of the recipient's death. Amendments have been made to the Social Security Act, including changes to section 202(b)(5)(B) and redesignating subparagraphs (F) through (K) as subparagraphs (E) through (J). Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to section 202(c)(1) regarding husband's insurance benefits. This involves redesignating subparagraphs and specifying the end of benefits upon the husband's death. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to section 202(c)(5)(B) and section 202(d)(1) regarding child's insurance benefits, specifying the end of benefits upon the child's death. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to widow's and widower's insurance benefits, specifying the end of benefits upon remarriage or death. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to widower's insurance benefits, specifying the end of benefits upon remarriage or death. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to parent's insurance benefits, specifying the end of benefits upon remarriage. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to disability insurance benefits, specifying the end of benefits upon the parent's death or remarriage. Amendments to the Social Security Act include adjustments to benefits for uninsured individuals at age 72 and an exemption from the maximum benefit cap. Exemption from maximum benefit cap for individuals under certain sections upon death. Increase in lump-sum death payments. Section 202(i) of the Social Security Act is amended to redesignate paragraphs, specify new subparagraphs, and adjust the dollar amount for death benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust the dollar amount for death benefits, with the applicable amount set at $955 for any calendar year, subject to annual adjustments determined by the Commissioner of Social Security based on the national average wage index. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust death benefits based on the national average wage index for the previous calendar year, rounding the amount to the nearest multiple of $5.00 if necessary. The amendments made by this Act will apply to deaths occurring after 90 days from the enactment date.
